alert.note: Alert for Bell; Breathitt; Floyd; Harlan; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Magoffin; Martin; Perry; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 2:40PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harlan, southwestern Martin, southeastern Bell, Letcher, central Leslie, Perry, Knott, Floyd, eastern Breathitt, western Pike and southeastern Magoffin Counties through 315 PM EST... At 240 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tiptop to Daley to 6 miles south of Cubage. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 35 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Duco, Carver Station, Tiptop, Carver, Swampton, Diablock, Evanston, Lambric, Daisydell and Vail around 245 PM EST. Gapville, Fredville, Viper, Gypsy, Jeff, Ordway, Cornettsville, Waldo, Daisy and Orchard around 250 PM EST. Vicco, Brainard, Dotson, Arminta, Sassafras, Wiscoal, Red Star, Bluefield, Anco and Ulvah around 255 PM EST. Letcher, Blackey, Cody, Carcassonne, Redfox, Gander, Carbon Glow, Dock, Carr Creek and Dirk around 300 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bath, Martin, Allen, Amelia, Lancer, Sackett, Isom, Cliff, Tillie, Littcarr, Prestonsburg, Whitesburg, Corn Fork Hollow, Polly, Colson, Dicks Creek, Lester, Lucastown, Alvin, Emma, Wheelwright, Fleming-Neon, Deane, Democrat, Endicott, Horn, Baker, McCombs, Ehkhorn Mine and Hemphill. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 50 and 59. Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 14. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 1 and 20. Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 9 and 15. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 19. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 31 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Breathitt; Floyd; Harlan; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Magoffin; Martin; Perry; Pike
